de.bkroeger.myvisio.view

Class WorksheetView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • de.bkroeger.myvisio.view.WorksheetView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class WorksheetView
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener

    Canvas für eine Seite einer Zeichnung.

    Dieser Canvas dient als DropTarget für Shapes aus dem Navigator.

    Author:
    bk
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • dragEnter

        public void dragEnter(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDragEvent e)

        This method is invoked when the user first drags something over us. If we understand the data type being dragged, then call acceptDrag() to tell the system that we're receptive.

        Also, we change our border as a "drag under" effect to signal that we can accept the drop.

        Specified by:
        dragEnter in interface java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener
        Parameters:
        e - - Event-Struktur

      • dragOver

        public void dragOver(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDragEvent e)

        Called when a drag operation is ongoing, while the mouse pointer is still over the operable part of the drop site for the DropTarget registered with this listener.

        Specified by:
        dragOver in interface java.awt.dnd.DropTargetListener
        Parameters:
        e - - Event-Struktur

      • dropActionChanged

        Specified by:

      • dragExit

      • drop

        public void drop(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDropEvent event)
        This is the key method of DropTargetListener. It is invoked when the user drops something on us.
